alert.note: Alert for Penobscot; Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:46PM EST until December 20 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Piscataquis River At Medford affecting Piscataquis and Penobscot Counties. For the Piscataquis River...including Blanchard, Dover-Foxcroft, Abbot Climate Station, Medford...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Piscataquis River at Medford. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding occurs along the Medford Road between Alder Brook to Robin Hollow Drive. Minor flooding along the lowland areas from Trestle Road Bridge downstream to Maxfield townline. Minor flooding along River Road and North Howland Road to I-95 Bridge in Maxfield to Howland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 8.6 feet. - At 12.0 feet, river approaches bankfull. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 13.7 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.5 feet on 12/22/1973. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1000 AM EST.
